Pre-Game Insights: The Minnesota Timberwolves faced the Chicago Bulls in their fourth preseason game. Anthony Edwards struggled offensively, shooting 6-for-23 from the field and finishing with 16 points. Julius Randle made his preseason debut, recording 15 points, six rebounds, and five assists. Rudy Gobert was dominant inside, posting 13 points and 17 rebounds, while Donte DiVincenzo added 17 points off the bench. NBA insider Shams Charania noted the strong relationship between Anthony Edwards and his new teammates, emphasizing their competitive fire and uniqueness in driving the team's success.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Timberwolves stunned many by trading Karl-Anthony Towns to the New York Knicks in exchange for Julius Randle and Donte DiVincenzo, breaking a well-documented friendship between Anthony Edwards and Towns. The Timberwolves will cap off their preseason against the Denver Nuggets and open their regular season against the LA Lakers on Oct. 22.
